content.raw:
In case you want to verify the equation for the computation of air density, below are the steps that brings you from `rho = pM/RT` to the equation we use in the code by replacing pressure `p` and temperature `T` by their `p(z)` and `T(z)` forms:

```
#!c++

rho(z) = M/(RT(z)) * (p0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR)
rho(z) = M/(R.T0)* (1+a.z/T0) *(p0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR)
rho(z) = p0M/(R.T0)*(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR-1
rho(z) = rho0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR-1 
```
content.html:
In case you want to verify the equation for the computation of air density, below are the steps that brings you from rho = pM/RT to the equation we use in the code by replacing pressure p and temperature T by their p(z) and T(z) forms:

rho(z) = M/(RT(z)) * (p0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR)
rho(z) = M/(R.T0)* (1+a.z/T0) *(p0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR)
rho(z) = p0M/(R.T0)*(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR-1
rho(z) = rho0(1+a.z/T0)^Mg/aR-1

content.raw:
There was a typo in the computation of adiabaticPower, it has now been fixed. A reference has been added: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Density_of_air#Altitude
Pressure and air density calculations are exactly like described on this page.
content.html: There was a typo in the computation of adiabaticPower, it has now been fixed. A reference has been added: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Density_of_air#Altitude Pressure and air density calculations are exactly like described on this page.

update.description:
This pull request provides a base class Atmosphere and a derived class AdiabaticAtmosphere that implements an adiabatic atmosphere model.

The global atmosphere parameters are defined in the SDF file, they consist of the temperature, pressure, mass density, and temperature gradient at sea level. The Atmosphere class is instantiated once during World initialization. A plugin can access the Atmosphere singleton with ```World::Atmosphere()``` and query its values at different altitudes. For now, only one type of atmosphere model is available: the adiabatic atmosphere model.

If it gets accepted, this feature would require a new optional section in the world SDF file (see related pull request [#241](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/241/new-element/diff)):

```
#!xml
<world name="default">
  <atmosphere name="default" type="adiabatic">
    <temperature>288.15</temperature> <!-- Temperature at sea level in kelvins -->
    <pressure>101325</pressure> <!-- Pressure at sea level in pascals -->
    <mass_density>1.225</mass_density> <!-- Mass density of the air at sea level in kg/m^3 -->
    <temperature_gradient>-0.0065</temperature_gradient> <!-- Temperature gradient with respect to increasing altitude at sea level in units of K/m -->
  </atmosphere>
</world>
```

At the client side, the atmosphere parameters are displayed in the property tree browser and can be changed dynamically.
update.title: Atmosphere model

content.raw: OK, I added a std::unique_ptr to AdiabaticPower. I also had to add two protected methods in Atmosphere, World() and Publish(), to, respectively, access the WorldPtr and publish a message (due to responsePub being defined in AtmospherePrivate class).
content.html: OK, I added a std::unique_ptr to AdiabaticPower. I also had to add two protected methods in Atmosphere, World() and Publish(), to, respectively, access the WorldPtr and publish a message (due to responsePub being defined in AtmospherePrivate class).
